When relentless warning failed, Ilyas (AS) supplicated—by Allah’s will, the heavens were shut, plunging the land into a multi-year drought. Famine and hardship undermined the cult’s hold, yet hearts proved stubborn, blaming the Prophet rather than examining their own estrangement:

فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَإِنَّهُمْ لَمُحْضَرُونَ

"But they denied him, so they will certainly be brought [for punishment]."

In his seclusion, tradition relates, Ilyas (AS) was comforted by angels, provided miraculous sustenance, and reinvigorated with spiritual resolve. When the time decreed, he returned to challenge the priests of Baal to public contest—who could call down rain or fire from their god? Only Ilyas’s call, with humility and certainty, was answered: Divine fire descended, vindication for tawhid before a silenced multitude.

The Repentance and Triumph of Truth

Witnessing the miracle and devastation, a fraction of the Israelites repented, reaffirming faith in Allah. Rain finally returned. Ilyas (AS) was claimed by some traditions to be taken up, alive, in body or soul (Allah knows best)—his mission completed, his name a harbinger for communities sliding into heedlessness.

وَسَلَامٌ عَلَىٰ إِلْ يَاسِينَ. إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ

"Peace be upon Ilyasin (Ilyas and his followers). Indeed, thus do We reward the doers of good."

Selected Quranic Verses: Ilyas (AS) and the Idol Worshippers

وَإِنَّ إِلْيَاسَ لَمِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ

"And indeed, Ilyas was among the messengers."

إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

"When he said to his people, 'Will you not fear Allah?'"

أَتَدْعُونَ بَعْلًا وَتَذَرُونَ أَحْسَنَ الْخَالِقِينَ

"Do you call upon Baal and forsake the best of creators?"

فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَإِنَّهُمْ لَمُحْضَرُونَ إِلَّا عِبَادَ اللَّهِ الْمُخْلَصِينَ

"But they denied him, so they will certainly be brought [for punishment], except the chosen servants of Allah."

وَسَلَامٌ عَلَىٰ إِلْ يَاسِينَ

"Peace be upon Ilyasin."

Philosophical, Moral, and Spiritual Reflections

The Meaning of Prophetic Courage

  • Ilyas (AS) teaches that the battle with idolatry is perennial—idols may wear gold or wood, but their essence remains as anything that competes with the remembrance and awe of Allah in the heart.
  • True reform requires confronting not only outward rituals but also comfort, conformity, and fear—calling souls to stand solitary, if necessary, alongside truth.
  • Prophetic anger is never for the self, but for hurling down the barriers that blind communities to Divine generosity and mercy.

The Angels and the Unseen Help

  • Ilyas’s reliance on the angels shows that the path of reform is sustained above all by the unseen: comfort, strength, and Divine signs come not to conquer, but to reawaken hearts.
  • The experience of drought, anguish, and miraculous sustenance reflects that the world bends to the will of its Creator—reminding believers to seek help through patience and prayer, never in desperation to gods of illusion.

Repentance and the Road to Mercy

  • The aftermath of drought, fire, and repentance anchors the truth that Divine punishment, in the Quranic worldview, is always a call to return—Allah’s mercy envelops the first who heed the call.
  • Even hardened idols can be broken by trial and sign, but the noblest are those who return at the first invitation, not the final ultimatum.

Historical and Theological Significance

Ilyas (AS) is remembered in Islamic tradition as a paradigmatic voice against the “forgotten god”—the idol that invades collective psyche in times of ease. His narrative is evoked in sermons, mystic poetry, and jurisprudence alike whenever communities risk exchanging reliance on Allah for comfort, expedience, or power. Sufi teachers see Ilyas as ever-living, present in every era’s struggle to resuscitate tawhid. The Quran’s unique brevity in his story magnifies its universal resonance—the confrontation with shirk is not past but forever present.

"And remember Our servants, Ibrahim, Ishaq and Yaqub, possessors of strength and vision."

Here, Ilyas stands in their line, uniting the courage of monotheism with unswerving compassion for his people’s return.

Conclusion: The Undying Call to Oneness

Ilyas (AS) carries the banner of those who cry for hearts trapped by idols ancient and modern—the divine voice calling, “Will you not fear Allah?” His saga is the summons for every soul surrounded by false gods of the age: stand, speak, resist conformity, and call rain down from the truest heavens. Angels bear witness, prayers part the drought, and peace is promised—so long as a single heart cleaves to the best of creators.

May every reader find in Ilyas’s courage the reflection of their highest calling: to break idols, inward and outward, and walk with the Prophets and the angels on the rain-soaked path back to the Source.
content.hinglish:
Nabuwwat ka Taana-Baana: Ilyas (AS) Buton ki Duniya mein

Dawud (AS) aur Sulaiman (AS) ke daur ke sadiyon baad, Israel ke shumaali qabeele—ghaflat aur taaqat ke lalach se kharab ho kar—but-parasti ke saayon mein gehri neend so gaye. Khush-haali ne ayyashi ko janam diya, aur Baal ki ibadat mulk ka qanoon ban gayi. Roohani khushki aur zulm se daaghdaar ek manzar ke darmiyan, Allah ne Ilyas (AS)—Elijah—ko bheja taaki woh dilon ko jagayein, jhoote maboodon ko challenge karein, aur tawhid (Ilahi Wahdat) ki mash'al ko dobara roshan karein. Unki kahani sirf zahiri but'on ke khilaaf ek jid-o-jehad nahi, balki un pardon ke khilaaf ek hamesha ki jung hai jo roohon ko unke Khaliq se door rakhte hain.

Ahem Kirdaar: Paighambar, But-parast aur Aasmani Gawah

  • Ilyas (AS): Ek paighambarana silsile se aane wale, Ilyas ko ba-waqar, yaqeen mein joshila, ibadat mein atal, aur burai ka saamna karne mein be-samjhauta bayan kiya gaya hai. Woh himmat, dua, khud-par-qaabu aur yeh sikhane ke liye mash'hoor hain ki asli taaqat sirf Allah ke aage jhukne mein hai.
  • Baal ki Qaum: Badshah Ahab aur Malka Jezebel ke tehat Bani Israel Baal ke firqe ka shikar ho gaye, aisi rasoomat mein mashghool ho kar jinhone rooh aur maashre ko zaleel kiya. Unke peshwa, pujari aur awaam, sab maadi kamyabi ke nashe mein choor ho gaye, but-parasti ki khamosh barbadi se andhe.
  • Neik Bacha hua Giroh: Ek chota sa giroh jo, museebat se ilham paakar ya aajiz ho kar, Ilyas ke saath tauba kar gaya, badhte hue khatre ke darmiyan tawhid par mazbooti se qayam raha.
  • Farishte:
    • Jibril (Gabriel): Ilahi hukum, tanbeeh (warning) aur tassalli laaye, khaas taur par Ilyas ki tanhai, jila-watni aur dua ke waqt.
    • Kiraman Katibin: Har khutbe, dua, mukhalifat aur maujize ko record kiya—saabit-qadmi ki meeras ko Aamaal-naame mein mehfooz karte hue.
    • Azaab ke Karkun: Allah ki taraf se unhein zindagi-bakhsh baarish aur sehat ki ziyarat rokne ka kaam saunpa gaya jab tak ki tauba na ho jaye—ek yaad-dehani ki anasir (elements) khud haq ki khidmat karte hain.

Baal ka Challenge: Dil aur Aasmano ko Dawat

Baal—tufaanon, zarkhezi aur munafe ke mabood—se sarshaar ek maashre ke khilaaf, Ilyas (AS) uthe, tamam Paighambaron ka paigham sunate hue:

إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ إِلْيَاسُ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

“Jab unke bhai Ilyas ne unse kaha: ‘Kya tum Allah se nahi daroge?’”

Unki dawat ne qaum ki bimari ki jad kaat di:

أَتَدْعُونَ بَعْلًا وَتَذَرُونَ أَحْسَنَ الْخَالِقِينَ. اللَّهَ رَبَّكُمْ وَرَبَّ آبَائِكُمُ الْأَوَّلِينَ

“Kya tum Baal ko pukaarte ho aur sabse behtareen paida karne wale ko chhod dete ho—Allah, tumhara Rab aur tumhare pichle baap-dada ka Rab?”

Unhone qaum ko tauba, insaaf aur zikr ki dawat di, josh se khabardar karte hue ki rizq, baarish aur barkat sirf Allah se aati hai, tarashe hue but'on ya bhooli hui khwahishon se nahi.

Nishanain aur Baarish ka Rukna

Jab musalsal tanbeeh nakaam ho gayi, toh Ilyas (AS) ne dua ki—Allah ki marzi se, aasman band ho gaye, aur zameen par kai saal ka qehat aa gaya. Bhook aur museebat ne is firqe ki pakad ko kamzor kar diya, lekin dil ziddi saabit hue, Paighambar ko ilzaam dete hue bajaye iske ki woh apni begaanagi par ghaur karein:

فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَإِنَّهُمْ لَمُحْضَرُونَ

“Lekin unhone unhein jhutlaya, toh woh yaqeenan [azaab ke liye] laaye jayenge.”

Apni tanhai mein, riwayat batati hai, Ilyas (AS) ko farishton ne tassalli di, maujizati rizq faraham kiya, aur roohani azm se dobara taaza-dam kiya. Jab muqarrar waqt aaya, toh woh Baal ke pujariyon ko ek aam muqable ke liye challenge karne wapas aaye—kaun apne mabood se baarish ya aag barsa sakta hai? Sirf Ilyas ki pukar, aajizi aur yaqeen ke saath, qubool hui: Ilahi aag nazil hui, ek khamosh bheed ke saamne tawhid ki jeet.

Tauba aur Haq ki Fatah

Maujiza aur tabahi dekh kar, Bani Israel ke ek hisse ne tauba ki, aur Allah par imaan ki tasdeeq ki. Aakhir-kaar baarish wapas aayi. Kuch riwayaton mein daawa kiya gaya hai ki Ilyas (AS) ko zinda, jism ya rooh mein utha liya gaya (Allah behtar jaanta hai)—unka mission mukammal ho gaya, unka naam ghaflat mein doobti qaumon ke liye ek pesh-khabar ban gaya.

وَسَلَامٌ عَلَىٰ إِلْ يَاسِينَ. إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ

“Salaam ho Ilyasin (Ilyas aur unke maanne walon) par. Beshak, Hum neki karne walon ko aisa hi sila dete hain.”

Muntakhab Qurani Aayat: Ilyas (AS) aur But-parast

وَإِنَّ إِلْيَاسَ لَمِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ

“Aur beshak, Ilyas rasoolon mein se the.”

إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

“Jab unhone apni qaum se kaha, ‘Kya tum Allah se nahi daroge?’”

أَتَدْعُونَ بَعْلًا وَتَذَرُونَ أَحْسَنَ الْخَالِقِينَ

“Kya tum Baal ko pukaarte ho aur sabse behtareen paida karne wale ko chhod dete ho?”

فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَإِنَّهُمْ لَمُحْضَرُونَ إِلَّا عِبَادَ اللَّهِ الْمُخْلَصِينَ

“Lekin unhone unhein jhutlaya, toh woh yaqeenan [azaab ke liye] laaye jayenge, siwaye Allah ke chune hue bandon ke.”

وَسَلَامٌ عَلَىٰ إِلْ يَاسِينَ

“Salaam ho Ilyasin par.”

Falsafiyana, Akhlaqi aur Roohani Ghaur-o-Fikr

Paighambarana Himmat ka Matlab

  • Ilyas (AS) sikhate hain ki but-parasti ke saath jung hamesha jari rehti hai—but sone ya lakdi ke ho sakte hain, lekin unka asal jauhar har us cheez ke taur par baaqi rehta hai jo dil mein Allah ke zikr aur haibat ka muqabla karti hai.
  • Asli islaah na sirf zahiri rasoomat, balki aaram, riwaj-parasti aur khauf ka saamna karne ki maang karti hai—roohon ko, agar zaroori ho toh, haq ke saath tanha khade hone ki dawat deti hai.
  • Paighambarana ghussa kabhi zaat ke liye nahi hota, balki un rukawaton ko girane ke liye hota hai jo qaumon ko Ilahi sakhawat aur rehmat se andha kar deti hain.

Farishte aur Ghaibi Madad

  • Ilyas ka farishton par bharosa dikhata hai ki islaah ka raasta sab se badh kar ghaib se qayam rehta hai: tassalli, taaqat aur Ilahi nishanain fatah haasil karne ke liye nahi, balki dilon ko dobara jagane ke liye aati hain.
  • Qehat, takleef aur maujizati rizq ka tajurba is baat ka aks hai ki duniya apne Khaliq ki marzi ke aage jhukti hai—mominon ko yaad dilate hue ki woh sabr aur dua ke zariye madad talaash karein, na ki dhoke ke maboodon se mayoosi mein.

Tauba aur Rehmat ka Raasta

  • Qehat, aag aur tauba ka anjaam is haqeeqat ko mazboot karta hai ki Ilahi azaab, Qurani nuqta-e-nazar mein, hamesha wapsi ki ek dawat hai—Allah ki rehmat sabse pehle pukar par dhyaan dene walon ko gher leti hai.
  • Sakht but bhi aazmaish aur nishani se tode ja sakte hain, lekin sabse azeem woh hain jo pehli dawat par wapas aate hain, na ki aakhri ultimatum par.

Tarikhi aur Deeni Ahmiyat

Ilyas (AS) Islami riwayat mein “bhulaye gaye mabood”—woh but jo aasani ke waqt ijtemai zehen par hamla karta hai—ke khilaaf ek misali awaaz ke taur par yaad kiye jaate hain. Unki kahani khutbon, soofiyana shayari aur fiqh (jurisprudence) mein us waqt yaad ki jaati hai jab qaumein Allah par bharose ko aaram, sahulat ya taaqat se badalne ka khatra mol leti hain. Sufi ustaad Ilyas ko hamesha zinda maante hain, jo har daur ki tawhid ko dobara zinda karne ki jid-o-jehad mein maujood hain. Quran mein unki kahani ki munfarid mukhtasari uski aalmi goonj ko badhati hai—shirk ke saath muqabla maazi nahi, balki hamesha maujood hai.

“Aur Hamare bandon, Ibrahim, Ishaq aur Yaqub ko yaad karo, jo taaqat aur baseerat wale the.”

Yahan, Ilyas unki saf mein khade hain, Tawheed ki himmat ko apni qaum ki wapsi ke liye atal hamdardi ke saath milate hue.

Nateeja: Wahdat ki na Khatam Hone Wali Pukar

Ilyas (AS) un logon ka jhanda uthaye hue hain jo qadeem aur jadeed but'on mein phanse dilon ke liye rote hain—Ilahi awaaz pukaar rahi hai, “Kya tum Allah se nahi daroge?” Unki dastaan har us rooh ke liye ek talab hai jo zamane ke jhoote maboodon se ghiri hui hai: khade ho, bolo, riwaj-parasti ka muqabla karo, aur sabse sacche aasmano se baarish barsao. Farishte gawah hain, duaein qehat ko khatam karti hain, aur aman ka waada kiya gaya hai—jab tak ek bhi dil sabse behtareen paida karne wale se juda rahe.

Dua hai ki har padhne wala Ilyas ki himmat mein apni sabse buland pukar ka aks paaye: andarooni aur berooni but'on ko todna, aur Paighambaron aur farishton ke saath baarish se bheegi hui us raah par wapas Asal Zariye ki taraf chalna.

content.english:
The Sacred Tapestry: Al-Yasa’ (AS) and the Mantle of Prophecy

In the long arc of Divine guidance, from Abrahamic forefathers to the kings and prophets of Israel, the thread of prophecy passed both through times of triumph and moments of spiritual peril. After Ilyas (AS)—the fiery reformer who opposed idolatry—departed or was veiled from the people, Allah in His mercy did not abandon the wayward Israelites. Instead, He raised Al-Yasa’ (AS)—known biblically as Elisha—a Prophet of patience, healing, and moral steadfastness. Though referenced only briefly in the Qur’an, Al-Yasa’s legacy is woven into a rich tradition of victory over spiritual decay, healing after drought, and the relentless pursuit of righteousness in a society teetering between remembrance and heedlessness.

Key Figures: Prophets, People, and the Hosts Unseen

  • Al-Yasa’ (AS): Successor and disciple of Ilyas (AS), celebrated in both Islamic and biblical traditions for his miracles, compassion, unwavering commitment to tawhid, and perseverance against societal decline. He exemplified the role of a Prophet as both healer and reformer—guiding communities back to the worship of the One.
  • Ilyas (AS): His mentor, whose struggle with Baal-worshippers paved the way for Al-Yasa’s mission.
  • The Israelites: A people fatigued by drought and division, sometimes reforming, often relapsing into old temptations of idolatry and injustice. Al-Yasa’ confronted their lapses as well as their spiritual needs.
  • The Angels:
    • Kiraman Katibin: Recording each act—miracles, admonitions, moments of patience and turning.
    • Jibril (Gabriel): As carrier of inspiration, comfort, and at times miraculous healing, upholding Al-Yasa’ in trial and in miraculous response.
    • Agents of Mercy and Chastisement: Delivering Divine decree—rain, health, or hardship—according to the faithfulness of the nation.

Succession and the Divine Mantle

With the departure of Ilyas (AS), a period of uncertainty swept over Israel. The need for spiritual continuity was answered as Al-Yasa’ (AS) was bestowed with prophecy—tradition describing how he sought, by yearning and prayer, to inherit the prophetic “mantle” or blessing of his teacher.

وَإِسْمَاعِيلَ وَالْيَسَعَ وَيُونُسَ وَلُوطًا وَكُلًّا فَضَّلْنَا عَلَى الْعَالَمِينَ

"And [mention] Ishmael and Elisha [Al-Yasa’] and Jonah and Lot, and all [of them] We preferred over the worlds."

Islamic and biblical traditions describe Al-Yasa’s deep attachment to Ilyas and his readiness to serve, his humility and hunger for God’s nearness. By Allah’s grace, he was empowered to carry forward the cause—now emphasizing not confrontation alone but also healing, restoration, and teaching.

The Life and Mission of Al-Yasa’ (AS): Healing, Mercy, and Persistence

Al-Yasa’s mission unfolded in the wake of Ilyas’s reformation. The people's spiritual exhaustion created opportunities for the Prophet’s gifts of healing and restoration:

  • Healing the Sick: By Allah’s permission, Al-Yasa’ was granted miraculous cures—restoring health to lepers, reviving the weak, and even (as some traditions relay) raising the dead.
  • Ending Drought: Where Ilyas invoked drought to discipline, Al-Yasa’ was known to pray for rain, restoring life and abundance to parched lands—a sign that repentance opens the gates of Divine mercy.
  • Guiding Kings and People: He advised just rulers, rebuffed arrogant tyrants, and encouraged social ethics—especially the return to equity, worship, and charity.
  • Steadfast in Adversity: In a time of relapse into idolatry, Al-Yasa’ never relented. Whether his followers were many or few, he persisted—reminding them, as all prophets did, "Return to your Lord; in Him are all healing and joy."

The Angels: Companions in Miracles, Mercy, and Memory

  • Jibril (AS): According to tradition, present as a bringer of Divine inspiration and, occasionally, the Divine power that made possible Al-Yasa’s miraculous deeds.
  • Kiraman Katibin: Meticulous chroniclers of the Prophet’s teachings, his acts of healing, patience amid rejection, and unwavering faith.
  • Agents of Sustenance: By Allah’s command, angels delivered rain, restored crops, or protected Al-Yasa from foes—ever the unseen hands serving the cause of tawhid.

Key Moments and Quranic Verses: Al-Yasa’s (AS) Station

وَاسْمَاعِيلَ وَالْيَسَعَ وَذَا الْكِفْلِ وَكُلٌّ مِّنَ الْأَخْيَارِ

"And Ishmael and Elisha [Al-Yasa’] and Dhul-Kifl, and all were among the outstanding."

إِسْمَاعِيلَ وَالْيَسَعَ ... وَكُلًّا فَضَّلْنَا عَلَى الْعَالَمِينَ

"Ishmael and Elisha ... and all [of them] We preferred over the worlds."

وَاذْكُرْ عِبَادَنَا إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَإِسْحَاقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ ... وَإِسْمَاعِيلَ وَالْيَسَعَ ...

"And remember Our servants, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob ... and Ishmael and Elisha ..."

The Qur’an places Al-Yasa’ amidst the ranks of the chosen and the outstanding, though without elaborate narrative. His mere mention signals enduring honor for patience, reform, and the bonds of prophetic succession.

Spiritual, Moral, and Philosophical Lessons

The Divine Principle of Succession and Continuity

  • Al-Yasa’s emergence after Ilyas demonstrates Allah’s continual care—never leaving His creation without guidance, and proving that a single sincere soul can carry forward the faith despite tides of indifference, darkness, or relapse.
  • The succession is spiritual before social; it is based on sincerity, yearning for nearness to Allah, and active service—not birth or rank.

The Meaning of Healing and Restoration

  • Al-Yasa’ shines as a healer—of body and spirit. His miracles teach that Divine aid comes in the hour of need, and that Prophets mend more than physical wounds; they restore hearts, families, and communities.
  • Angels are vehicles of these blessings—delivering not only revelation but also mercy, sustenance, and healing during times of scarcity or affliction.

Persistence in the Face of Spiritual Fatigue

  • The community’s tendency to relapse into old patterns calls every believer to vigilance: sustaining faith is harder than awakening it; true reform is as much nurture as it is revolution.
  • Al-Yasa’s patience amid cycles of reform and relapse, drought and rain, models resilience and trust in the slow, mysterious pace of Divine work.

The Community and Leadership

  • Leadership in Islam is above all service. Al-Yasa’ taught and healed, remaining accessible, gentle, yet firm; his legacy rebukes all who would wield authority for pride, profit, or heedlessness.
  • Just as the Prophets pass on their light, every community must commit to its renewal and care—never abandoning the lessons of the past nor surrendering to apathy.

Historical and Theological Significance

Though Al-Yasa’ (AS) is not associated with a volume of revelation, his story anchors the principles of prophetic succession, the integration of spiritual and material healing, and the ongoing need for reform. In Islamic tradition, his mention stands as a seal on the virtue of patience, quiet service, and the seamless continuation of tawhid’s beacon. Sufi mystics see in his life the emblem of the loving disciple who graduates to guide; theologians highlight the importance of upholding faith in times of stagnation; jurists refer to his lessons in justice, charity, and community healing as blueprints for enduring societies.

"And each [of them] We preferred above the worlds."

The Qur’an’s economy of words regarding Al-Yasa’ is not a diminishment but rather an elevation—his legacy is universal, available to every one of the "outstanding" who inherit Prophetic resolve.

Conclusion: The Quiet Flame of Prophetic Succession

In the chain of prophets, Al-Yasa’ (AS) is the gentle restorer—proving that continuity is itself a miracle, and that hope outlasts every drought, whether of rain or of spirit. His mission whispers for every era: do not despair when reform falters or numbers dwindle. Aspire instead to patience, gentleness, and trust in the slow return of mercy. As hurricanes give way to springs, every soul that inherits guidance, serves in humility, and seeks to mend hearts is a successor to Al-Yasa’s legacy. In the shadow and memory of his mission, angels still record; rain still returns; and the light of tawhid never fully dims.
content.hinglish:
Muqaddas Taana-Baana: Al-Yasa’ (AS) aur Nabuwwat ki Chadar

Ilahi hidayat ke lambe safar mein, Abrahami aba-o-ajdad se lekar Israel ke badshahon aur paighambaron tak, nabuwwat ka dhaaga fatah ke zamanon aur roohani khatre ke lamhaat, dono se guzra. Ilyas (AS)—woh joshile musleh (reformer) jinhone but-parasti ki mukhalifat ki—ke rukhsat hone ya logon se parda kar lene ke baad, Allah ne Apni rehmat se gumrah Bani Israel ko nahi chhoda. Balki, Usne Al-Yasa’ (AS)—jinhein anjeel mein Elisha ke naam se jaana jaata hai—ko uthaya, jo sabr, shifa aur akhlaqi saabit-qadmi ke Paighambar the. Agarche Qur’an mein unka zikr sirf mukhtasar hai, Al-Yasa’ ki meeras roohani zawaal par fatah, qehat ke baad shifa, aur ek aise maashre mein neki ki musalsal justaju ki ek ameer riwayat mein buni hui hai jo yaad aur ghaflat ke darmiyan dagmaga raha tha.

Ahem Kirdaar: Paighambar, Log aur Ghaibi Lashkar

  • Al-Yasa’ (AS): Ilyas (AS) ke janasheen aur shagird, Islami aur anjeeli, dono riwayaton mein apne maujizon, hamdardi, tawhid ke liye atal commitment aur maasharti zawaal ke khilaaf saabit-qadmi ke liye mash'hoor hain. Unhone ek Paighambar ke kirdaar ko shifa dene wale aur musleh, dono ke taur par misali banaya—qaumon ko Wahid ki ibadat ki taraf wapas rehnumayi karte hue.
  • Ilyas (AS): Unke ustaad, jinki Baal-paraston ke saath kashmakash ne Al-Yasa’ ke mission ke liye raasta hamwar kiya.
  • Bani Israel: Qehat aur phoot se thaki hui ek qaum, kabhi islaah karti, kabhi but-parasti aur na-insaafi ke purane behkawon mein wapas chali jaati. Al-Yasa’ ne unki ghaltiyon aur unki roohani zarooraton, dono ka saamna kiya.
  • Farishte:
    • Kiraman Katibin: Har amal—maujize, naseehtein, sabr aur wapsi ke lamhaat—ko record karte hue.
    • Jibril (Gabriel): Ilham, tassalli aur baaz auqaat maujizati shifa ke haamil ke taur par, aazmaish mein aur maujizati jawab mein Al-Yasa’ ko sahara dete hue.
    • Rehmat aur Azaab ke Karkun: Qaum ki wafadari ke mutabiq Ilahi faisla—baarish, sehat ya museebat—pahunchate hue.

Janasheeni aur Ilahi Chadar

Ilyas (AS) ke rukhsat hone ke saath, Israel par be-yaqeeni ka daur chha gaya. Roohani tasalsul ki zaroorat ka jawab us waqt mila jab Al-Yasa’ (AS) ko nabuwwat ata ki gayi—riwayat batati hai ki kaise unhone, khwahish aur dua ke zariye, apne ustaad ki paighambarana “chadar” ya barkat wirasat mein paane ki koshish ki.

وَإِسْمَاعِيلَ وَالْيَسَعَ وَيُونُسَ وَلُوطًا وَكُلًّا فَضَّلْنَا عَلَى الْعَالَمِينَ

“Aur [zikr karo] Isma'il aur Al-Yasa’ aur Yunus aur Lut ka, aur un sab ko Humne tamam jahano par fazilat di.”

Islami aur anjeeli riwayatein Al-Yasa’ ki Ilyas se gehri wabastagi aur khidmat ke liye unki tayyari, unki aajizi aur Allah ki qurbat ke liye unki talab ko bayan karti hain. Allah ke fazl se, unhein is kaam ko aage badhane ki taaqat mili—ab na sirf muqable par, balki shifa, bahaali aur taleem par bhi zor dete hue.

Al-Yasa’ (AS) ki Zindagi aur Mission: Shifa, Rehmat aur Saabit-qadmi

Al-Yasa’ ka mission Ilyas ki islaah ke baad shuru hua. Logon ki roohani thakawat ne Paighambar ke shifa aur bahaali ke tohfon ke liye mauqe paida kiye:

  • Bimaron ko Shifa Dena: Allah ke hukum se, Al-Yasa’ ko maujizati ilaj ata kiye gaye—kodhiyon ko sehat bahaal karna, kamzoron ko dobara zinda karna, aur yahan tak ki (jaisa ki kuch riwayatein batati hain) murdon ko uthana.
  • Qehat Khatam Karna: Jahan Ilyas ne tarbiyat ke liye qehat ki dua ki, Al-Yasa’ baarish ke liye dua karne ke liye jaane jaate the, sookhi zameenon par zindagi aur farakhi bahaal karte hue—ek nishani ki tauba Ilahi rehmat ke darwaze kholti hai.
  • Badshahon aur Logon ki Rehnumayi: Unhone adil hukmaranon ko mashwara diya, mutakabbir zalimon ko radd kiya, aur samaaji akhlaqiyat ko farogh diya—khaas taur par barabari, ibadat aur sadqe ki taraf wapsi.
  • Museebat mein Saabit-qadam: But-parasti mein wapsi ke daur mein, Al-Yasa’ kabhi peeche nahi hate. Chahe unke maanne wale zyada the ya kam, woh lage rahe—unhein yaad dilate hue, jaisa ki tamam paighambaron ne kiya, “Apne Rab ki taraf lauto; Usi mein tamam shifa aur khushi hai.”

Farishte: Maujizon, Rehmat aur Yaad mein Saathi

  • Jibril (AS): Riwayat ke mutabiq, Ilahi ilham ke laane wale aur, kabhi kabhar, us Ilahi qudrat ke haamil ke taur par maujood the jisne Al-Yasa’ ke maujizati kamon ko mumkin banaya.
  • Kiraman Katibin: Paighambar ki taleemat, unke shifa ke aamaal, inkaar ke darmiyan sabr aur atal imaan ke ehtiyat se likhne wale.
  • Rizq ke Karkun: Allah ke hukum se, farishte baarish laate, faslein bahaal karte, ya Al-Yasa’ ko dushmanon se bachate—hamesha tawhid ke maqsad ki khidmat karne wale ghaibi haath.

Ahem Lamhaat aur Qurani Aayat: Al-Yasa’ (AS) ka Maqaam

وَاسْمَاعِيلَ وَالْيَسَعَ وَذَا الْكِفْلِ وَكُلٌّ مِّنَ الْأَخْيَارِ

“Aur Isma'il aur Al-Yasa’ aur Dhul-Kifl, aur sab behtareen logon mein se the.”

إِسْمَاعِيلَ وَالْيَسَعَ ... وَكُلًّا فَضَّلْنَا عَلَى الْعَالَمِينَ

“Isma'il aur Al-Yasa’ ... aur un sab ko Humne tamam jahano par fazilat di.”

وَاذْكُرْ عِبَادَنَا إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَإِسْحَاقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ ... وَإِسْمَاعِيلَ وَالْيَسَعَ ...

“Aur Hamare bandon, Ibrahim, Ishaq aur Yaqub ... aur Isma'il aur Al-Yasa’ ko yaad karo ...”

Qur’an Al-Yasa’ ko chune hue aur behtareen logon ki safon mein rakhta hai, agarche tafseeli kahani ke baghair. Unka sirf zikr hi sabr, islaah aur paighambarana janasheeni ke rishton ke liye hamesha ki izzat ka ishara hai.

Roohani, Akhlaqi aur Falsafiyana Sabaq

Janasheeni aur Tasalsul ka Ilahi Usool

  • Ilyas ke baad Al-Yasa’ ka aana Allah ki musalsal parwah ko zahir karta hai—Apni makhlooq ko kabhi hidayat ke baghair nahi chhodna, aur yeh saabit karna ki ek ikhlaas wali rooh be-parwai, tareeki ya wapsi ki lehron ke bawajood imaan ko aage badha sakti hai.
  • Janasheeni samaaji se pehle roohani hai; yeh ikhlaas, Allah ki qurbat ki khwahish aur fa'aal (active) khidmat par mabni hai—na ki paidaish ya darje par.

Shifa aur Bahaali ka Matlab

  • Al-Yasa’ ek shifa dene wale ke taur par chamakte hain—jism aur rooh ke. Unke maujize sikhate hain ki Ilahi madad zaroorat ke waqt aati hai, aur yeh ki Paighambar jismaani zakhmon se zyada bharte hain; woh dilon, khandanوں aur qaumon ko bahaal karte hain.
  • Farishte in barkaton ke zariye hain—na sirf wahi, balki kami ya museebat ke waqt rehmat, rizq aur shifa bhi pahunchate hain.

Roohani Thakawat ke Saamne Saabit-qadmi

  • Qaum ki purane taur-tareeqon mein wapas jaane ki raghbat har momin ko hoshiyari ki dawat deti hai: imaan ko qayam rakhna use jagane se zyada mushkil hai; asli islaah jitni inqilab hai utni hi parwarish bhi hai.
  • Islaah aur wapsi, qehat aur baarish ke chakron ke darmiyan Al-Yasa’ ka sabr Ilahi kaam ki aahista, pur-israr raftaar mein lachak aur bharose ka namoona hai.

Qaum aur Qayadat

  • Islam mein qayadat sab se badh kar khidmat hai. Al-Yasa’ ne sikhaya aur shifa di, dastiyab, narm, lekin mazboot rehte hue; unki meeras un sab ko daant'ti hai jo iqtedar ko takabbur, munafe ya ghaflat ke liye istemal karte hain.
  • Jaise Paighambar apni roshni aage badhate hain, har qaum ko apni tajdeed aur dekhbhal ke liye commitment karni chahiye—kabhi maazi ke sabaq ko na chhodte hue aur na hi be-hisi ke aage haar maante hue.

Tarikhi aur Deeni Ahmiyat

Agarche Al-Yasa’ (AS) kisi wahi ke jild se munsalik nahi hain, unki kahani paighambarana janasheeni, roohani aur maadi shifa ke ittehad, aur islaah ki musalsal zaroorat ke usoolon ko mazboot karti hai. Islami riwayat mein, unka zikr sabr, khamosh khidmat aur tawhid ki roshni ke be-रोक-टोक tasalsul ki fazilat par ek mohar ke taur par qayam hai. Sufi mystics unki zindagi mein us pyare shagird ki alamat dekhte hain jo rehnumayi ke liye tarbiyat paata hai; deeniyat ke maahir thehrav ke waqt imaan ko qayam rakhne ki ahmiyat par zor dete hain; fuqaha (jurists) insaaf, sadqa aur qaumi shifa mein unke sabaq ko paidaar maashron ke liye naqsh-e-qadam ke taur par dekhte hain.

“Aur unmein se har ek ko Humne tamam jahano par fazilat di.”

Al-Yasa’ ke baare mein Qur’an ke kam alfaaz unki ahmiyat ko kam nahi karte, balki unhein buland karte hain—unki meeras aalmi hai, har us “behtareen” shakhs ke liye dastiyab hai jo Paighambarana azm wirasat mein paata hai.

Nateeja: Paighambarana Janasheeni ka Khamosh Shola

Paighambaron ki zanjeer mein, Al-Yasa’ (AS) narm-dil bahaal karne wale hain—yeh saabit karte hue ki tasalsul khud ek maujiza hai, aur yeh ki umeed har qehat, chahe baarish ka ho ya rooh ka, se zyada zinda rehti hai. Unka mission har daur ke liye sargoshi karta hai: jab islaah dagmagaye ya tadaad kam ho jaye toh mayoos na ho. Balki sabr, narmi aur rehmat ki aahista wapsi par bharose ki khwahish karo. Jaise toofan chashmon ko raasta dete hain, har rooh jo hidayat wirasat mein paati hai, aajizi se khidmat karti hai, aur dilon ko jodne ki koshish karti hai, Al-Yasa’ ki meeras ki janasheen hai. Unke mission ke saaye aur yaad mein, farishte ab bhi record karte hain; baarish ab bhi wapas aati hai; aur tawhid ki roshni kabhi poori tarah se madham nahi hoti.

content.english:
The Celestial Tapestry: Uzayr (AS), Sleep, and Resurrection

In the centuries after the long march of prophets and the rise and ruin of powerful nations, the land of Bani Israel was devastated—Jerusalem’s sacred precincts lay in ruin, its inhabitants scattered, its promise dimmed under the shadow of exile. Among the bewildered and the exiled, Uzayr (AS)—known as Ezra in biblical tradition—wandered upon a scene of desolation, the city once blessed and now emptied by the torrents of war. Yet, as always in the Divine plan, miracles unfold not out of spectacle, but in the humbling depths of doubt and wonder. The parable of Uzayr is not one only of sleep, but of the revelation of Allah’s unmatched power to revive what is dead, renew faith, and establish certainty in resurrection.

Key Characters: Uzayr (AS), the Angels, and the People

  • Uzayr (AS): A righteous man of deep wisdom and learning, sometimes described as a prophet, renowned for his prayer, devotion, and sorrow for the people of Israel’s plight. He is celebrated for seeking to understand the mysteries of resurrection, fully submitting when the answer arrived in lived miracle.
  • The Angels:
    • Angelic Agents of Death and Life: Ordered by Allah to enact the profound miracle in Uzayr’s story—causing his sleep, guarding his remains, and orchestrating his return to consciousness.
    • Kiraman Katibin: Recording each moment of reflection, doubt, slumber, and awakening for Uzayr and his community.
  • The Community of Israel: Embodying the continuity of faith, doubt, and memory. Their testimony on Uzayr’s return reanchors the connection between Divine lesson and collective transformation.

The Scene of Desolation: Uzayr’s Contemplation

The Qur’an paints his journey with vivid brevity: Uzayr, upon arriving at the shattered ruins, observed the heaps of masonry, the absence of life, and the total effacement of hope. In a moment of contemplation, his heart questioned not the existence of God, but the how of restoration:

أَوْ كَالَّذِي مَرَّ عَلَىٰ قَرْيَةٍ وَهِيَ خَاوِيَةٌ عَلَىٰ عُرُوشِهَا قَالَ أَنَّىٰ يُحْيِي هَٰذِهِ اللَّهُ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَا

"Or [consider] the one who passed by a town which had collapsed in its roofs. He said, 'How will Allah bring this to life after its death?'"

This was no denial; it was the yearning of a soul for deeper gnosis—an intimate seeker’s longing to witness the heart of Divine mercy and might.

The Miracle: Sleep, Death, and the Angelic Decree

In response, Allah ordained an extraordinary sign: Uzayr was caused to die—or sleep in a deathlike state—for one hundred years. His own donkey and provisions bore witness to the passage of time. During his slumber, the angels preserved his body, his nourishment, and all that surrounded him—demonstrating their roles as agents of preservation, death, and life.

فَأَمَاتَهُ اللَّهُ مِائَةَ عَامٍ ثُمَّ بَعَثَهُ

"So Allah caused him to die for a hundred years; then He revived him..."

The angels, as beings who neither tire nor forget, became the keepers of Uzayr’s mystery—standing between the visible and invisible worlds while Allah’s decree unfolded.

The Awakening: The Proof of Resurrection

When Uzayr awakened, he was asked, “How long did you remain [thus]?” His response—“A day or part of a day”—reveals both the relativity of human time and the depth of the Divine miracle. Allah then instructed:

قَالَ فَانْظُرْ إِلَىٰ طَعَامِكَ وَشَرَابِكَ لَمْ يَتَسَنَّهْ وَانْظُرْ إِلَىٰ حِمَارِكَ وَلِنَجْعَلَكَ آيَةً لِّلنَّاسِ

"He said, 'Look at your food and your drink; they have not changed with time. And look at your donkey—thus We make you a sign for the people.'"

Before his eyes, the bones of his donkey reassembled, clothed again in flesh and sinew—by angelic action and Divine command—leaving Uzayr in awe. The proof was irrefutable: Allah not only gives death but brings forth life at His Will, even when all visible connections have vanished.

The Return: Revival of Faith Among the People

Upon reentering Jerusalem, Uzayr discovered a generation which did not remember him. Yet some elderly recognized him. He was once more among his people, restoring to them the Torah by Allah’s gift—a further miracle, for the scriptures had been effaced from memory over the century. His presence thus revived not only the flesh of a donkey, but the spirit of a nation.

In Islamic lore, this restoration affirmed Allah’s continued mercy to the Community of Israel—proof for both bodily resurrection and the enduring possibility of spiritual revival.

Selected Quranic Verses: The Sleep and Resurrection of Uzayr

أَوْ كَالَّذِي مَرَّ عَلَىٰ قَرْيَةٍ وَهِيَ خَاوِيَةٌ عَلَىٰ عُرُوشِهَا قَالَ أَنَّىٰ يُحْيِي هَٰذِهِ اللَّهُ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَا

"Or [consider] the one who passed by a town which had collapsed in its roofs. He said, 'How will Allah bring this to life after its death?'"

فَأَمَاتَهُ اللَّهُ مِائَةَ عَامٍ ثُمَّ بَعَثَهُ قَالَ كَمْ لَبِثْتَ قَالَ لَبِثْتُ يَوْمًا أَوْ بَعْضَ يَوْمٍ

"So Allah caused him to die for a hundred years; then He revived him. He said, 'How long have you remained [dead]?' [Uzayr] said, 'I have remained a day or part of a day.'"

قَالَ فَانْظُرْ إِلَىٰ طَعَامِكَ وَشَرَابِكَ لَمْ يَتَسَنَّهْ وَانْظُرْ إِلَىٰ حِمَارِكَ وَلِنَجْعَلَكَ آيَةً لِّلنَّاسِ وَانْظُرْ إِلَى الْعِظَامِ كَيْفَ نُنشِزُهَا ثُمَّ نَكْسُوهَا لَحْمًا

"He said, 'Look at your food and your drink; they have not changed... and look at your donkey... and look at the bones—how We raise them and then We cover them with flesh.'..."

Philosophical, Spiritual, and Moral Reflections

The Mystery and Certainty of Resurrection

  • Uzayr’s experience is the archetype of transformative gnosis: genuine questioning, met by Divine demonstration, leads to perfect yaqin (certainty) and submission.
  • The episode embodies the Qur’anic method: Allah instructs not with abstract philosophy but incarnate reality—signs in the world and the self.

The Role of Angels: Agents of Transition and Signs

  • Angels move between commands of death and life, not as independent actors but as perfect executors of Allah’s Will—teaching believers that all states, from sleep to resurrection, pass through unseen hands aligned with the Divine.
  • Their presence reassures that the transition from this world to the next, from decay to new life, is not chaos but perfectly ordered mercy.

The Compassion and Pedagogy of Allah

  • The story reveals Allah’s approach: sincere seekers are not punished for their longing, but educated through signs—doubt, when joined to faith, can itself become the path of certainty.
  • The communal aspect—Uzayr’s return restoring scripture and faith—demonstrates that individual miracles serve the larger purpose of collective guidance and mercy.

Historical and Theological Significance

In Islamic tradition, Uzayr (AS) is revered for his patience, humility, and role as a restorer of faith—though not counted among the great law-giving prophets. His story underscores the doctrine of bodily resurrection, rebukes skepticism (from both believers and deniers), and affirms that Divine power encompasses all impossibilities.

Over time, the parable anchored debates about ma’ad (the Afterlife) in Islamic theology. Sufi teachers interpret the “hundred years’ sleep” as an allegory for the oblivion of heedlessness, with awakening as the return to spiritual vision. The miraculous reconstitution of the donkey reveals the granular detail of Allah’s mercy—nothing in creation, however forgotten or decayed, lies beyond restoration by His command.

أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَى الَّذِينَ خَرَجُوا مِن دِيَارِهِمْ وَهُمْ أُلُوفٌ حَذَرَ الْمَوْتِ ... ثُمَّ أَحْيَاهُمْ

"Have you not considered those who left their homes in many thousands, fearing death? Allah said to them, 'Die'; then He restored them to life..."

Conclusion: The Sleep, the Awakening, and the Promise Renewed

The story of Uzayr (AS) is the ever-renewing lesson that neither time, nor catastrophe, nor the deepest grave can forestall the mercy and omnipotence of Allah. To walk among ruins, to wonder how life will return, is the prelude to seeing resurrection with one’s own eyes. Angels stand witness, death opens only onto new beginnings, and the soul, like the bones of the donkey, will be re-clothed in grace—at Allah’s word alone. May every heart draw from Uzayr’s miracle a living certainty: despair is but a slumber before the dawn of hope, and every ruin—whether of soul, city, or world—lays the stage for the greatest awakening.
content.hinglish:
Aasmani Taana-Baana: Uzayr (AS), Neend aur Qayamat

Paighambaron ke lambe safar aur taqatwar qaumon ke urooj-o-zawaal ke sadiyon baad, Bani Israel ki sarzameen tabah ho gayi—Jerusalem ke muqaddas ahate khandar ban gaye, uske bashinde muntashir ho gaye, uska waada jila-watni ke saaye mein dhundla gaya. Hairan aur jila-watan logon ke darmiyan, Uzayr (AS)—jinhein anjeeli riwayat mein Ezra ke naam se jaana jaata hai—ek weerani ke manzar par ghoom rahe the, woh sheher jo kabhi mubarak tha aur ab jung ki lehron se khaali ho chuka tha. Lekin, jaisa ki hamesha Ilahi mansoobe mein hota hai, maujize tamashe se nahi, balki shaq aur hairat ki aajiz gehraiyon mein zahir hote hain. Uzayr ki misaal sirf neend ki nahi, balki Allah ki us be-misaal qudrat ke izhar ki hai jo murdon ko zinda karti hai, imaan ko taaza karti hai, aur qayamat mein yaqeen qayam karti hai.

Ahem Kirdaar: Uzayr (AS), Farishte aur Log

  • Uzayr (AS): Gehri hikmat aur ilm wale ek neik insaan, jinhein kabhi kabhi ek paighambar ke taur par bayan kiya jaata hai, jo apni dua, ibadat aur Bani Israel ki halat par afsos ke liye mash'hoor the. Unhein qayamat ke asrar ko samajhne ki koshish karne ke liye saraha jaata hai, aur jab jawab zinda maujize ki surat mein aaya toh unhone mukammal ita'at ki.
  • Farishte:
    • Maut aur Zindagi ke Farishte: Allah ke hukum se Uzayr ki kahani mein gehre maujize ko anjaam dene wale—unki neend ka sabab bante, unke jism ki hifazat karte, aur unke hosh mein wapsi ka intezam karte.
    • Kiraman Katibin: Uzayr aur unki qaum ke liye ghaur-o-fikr, shaq, neend aur bedaari ke har lamhe ko record karte hue.
  • Israel ki Qaum: Imaan, shaq aur yaadasht ke tasalsul ka mujassam. Uzayr ki wapsi par unki gawaahi Ilahi sabaq aur ijtemai tabdeeli ke darmiyan raabte ko dobara mazboot karti hai.

Weerani ka Manzar: Uzayr ka Ghaur-o-Fikr

Qur’an unke safar ko wazeh mukhtasari ke saath bayan karta hai: Uzayr, toote hue khandar par pahunch kar, malbe ke dheron, zindagi ki adam-maujoodgi aur umeed ke mukammal khatme ka mushahida karte hain. Ghaur-o-fikr ke ek lamhe mein, unke dil ne Khuda ke wujood par nahi, balki bahaali ke kaise hone par sawal kiya:

أَوْ كَالَّذِي مَرَّ عَلَىٰ قَرْيَةٍ وَهِيَ خَاوِيَةٌ عَلَىٰ عُرُوشِهَا قَالَ أَنَّىٰ يُحْيِي هَٰذِهِ اللَّهُ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَا

“Ya [us shakhs par ghaur karo] jo ek aise sheher se guzra jo apni chhaton par gira hua tha. Usne kaha, ‘Allah isko uski maut ke baad kaise zinda karega?’”

Yeh inkaar nahi tha; yeh ek rooh ki gehri ma'rifat ke liye tarap thi—ek qareebi talaash karne wale ki Ilahi rehmat aur qudrat ke dil ko dekhne ki khwahish.

Maujiza: Neend, Maut aur Farishton ka Faisla

Jawab mein, Allah ne ek ghair-mamooli nishani muqarrar ki: Uzayr ko sau saal tak maut di gayi—ya maut jaisi halat mein sulaya gaya. Unka apna gadha aur samaan waqt ke guzarne ke gawah bane. Unki neend ke dauran, farishton ne unke jism, unki ghiza aur unke gird-o-pesh ki har cheez ko mehfooz rakha—hifazat, maut aur zindagi ke karkun ke taur par apne kirdaar ko zahir karte hue.

فَأَمَاتَهُ اللَّهُ مِائَةَ عَامٍ ثُمَّ بَعَثَهُ

“Toh Allah ne use sau saal tak maut di; phir Usne use dobara zinda kiya...”

Farishte, aisi makhlooq jo na thakti hai aur na bhoolti hai, Uzayr ke raaz ke muhafiz ban gaye—zahir aur ghaib ki duniyaon ke darmiyan khade rehte hue jab tak Allah ka faisla zahir na ho jaye.

Bedaari: Qayamat ka Saboot

Jab Uzayr jaage, toh unse poocha gaya, “Tum [is halat mein] kitni der rahe?” Unka jawab—“Ek din ya din ka kuch hissa”—insani waqt ki nisbiyat (relativity) aur Ilahi maujize ki gehrai, dono ko zahir karta hai. Phir Allah ne hidayat di:

قَالَ فَانْظُرْ إِلَىٰ طَعَامِكَ وَشَرَابِكَ لَمْ يَتَسَنَّهْ وَانْظُرْ إِلَىٰ حِمَارِكَ وَلِنَجْعَلَكَ آيَةً لِّلنَّاسِ

“Unhone kaha, ‘Apne khane aur peene ko dekho; woh waqt ke saath nahi badle. Aur apne gadhe ko dekho—is tarah Hum tumhein logon ke liye ek nishani banate hain.’”

Unki aankhon ke saamne, unke gadhe ki haddiyan dobara jud gayin, phir se gosht aur patthon se dhak gayin—farishton ke amal aur Ilahi hukum se—jisne Uzayr ko hairat mein daal diya. Saboot na-qabil-e-tardeed tha: Allah na sirf maut deta hai, balki Apni marzi se zindagi bhi paida karta hai, yahan tak ki jab tamam zahiri raabte khatam ho chuke hon.

Wapsi: Qaum ke Darmiyan Imaan ki Tajdeed

Jerusalem mein dobara dakhil hone par, Uzayr ne ek aisi nasl paayi jo unhein nahi pehchanti thi. Lekin kuch buzurgon ne unhein pehchan liya. Woh ek baar phir apni qaum ke darmiyan the, Allah ke tohfe se unhein Torah wapas lauta rahe the—ek aur maujiza, kyunki sadi ke dauran kitabein yaadasht se mit chuki theen. Is tarah unki maujoodgi ne na sirf ek gadhe ke jism ko, balki ek qaum ki rooh ko bhi zinda kar diya.

Islami riwayat mein, is bahaali ne Israel ki qaum par Allah ki musalsal rehmat ki tasdeeq ki—jismaani qayamat aur roohani tajdeed ke hamesha baaqi rehne wale imkaan, dono ka saboot.

Muntakhab Qurani Aayat: Uzayr ki Neend aur Qayamat

أَوْ كَالَّذِي مَرَّ عَلَىٰ قَرْيَةٍ وَهِيَ خَاوِيَةٌ عَلَىٰ عُرُوشِهَا قَالَ أَنَّىٰ يُحْيِي هَٰذِهِ اللَّهُ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَا

“Ya [us shakhs par ghaur karo] jo ek aise sheher se guzra jo apni chhaton par gira hua tha. Usne kaha, ‘Allah isko uski maut ke baad kaise zinda karega?’”

فَأَمَاتَهُ اللَّهُ مِائَةَ عَامٍ ثُمَّ بَعَثَهُ قَالَ كَمْ لَبِثْتَ قَالَ لَبِثْتُ يَوْمًا أَوْ بَعْضَ يَوْمٍ

“Toh Allah ne use sau saal tak maut di; phir Usne use dobara zinda kiya. Usne kaha, ‘Tum [murda halat mein] kitni der rahe?’ [Uzayr ne] kaha, ‘Main ek din ya din ka kuch hissa raha.’”

قَالَ فَانْظُرْ إِلَىٰ طَعَامِكَ وَشَرَابِكَ لَمْ يَتَسَنَّهْ وَانْظُرْ إِلَىٰ حِمَارِكَ وَلِنَجْعَلَكَ آيَةً لِّلنَّاسِ وَانْظُرْ إِلَى الْعِظَامِ كَيْفَ نُنشِزُهَا ثُمَّ نَكْسُوهَا لَحْمًا

“Unhone kaha, ‘Apne khane aur peene ko dekho; woh nahi badle... aur apne gadhe ko dekho... aur haddiyon ko dekho—kaise Hum unhein uthate hain aur phir unhein gosht se dhakte hain.’...”

Falsafiyana, Roohani aur Akhlaqi Ghaur-o-Fikr

Qayamat ka Raaz aur Yaqeen

  • Uzayr ka tajurba tabdeeli lane wali ma'rifat (gnosis) ki misaal hai: sacchi justaju, jiska jawab Ilahi namoone se milta hai, mukammal yaqeen (certainty) aur ita'at ki taraf le jaati hai.
  • Yeh waqia Qurani tareeqe ka mujassam hai: Allah abstract falsafe se nahi, balki zinda haqeeqat se hidayat dete hain—duniya aur zaat mein nishanain.

Farishton ka Kirdar: Intaqal aur Nishaniyon ke Karkun

  • Farishte maut aur zindagi ke ahkamaat ke darmiyan harkat karte hain, azaad karkun ke taur par nahi, balki Allah ki Marzi ke mukammal anjaam dene walon ke taur par—mominon ko sikhate hue ki tamam halatein, neend se lekar qayamat tak, Ilahi Zaat ke saath jude hue ghaibi haathon se guzarti hain.
  • Unki maujoodgi yaqeen dilati hai ki is duniya se agli duniya tak, bosidgi se nayi zindagi tak ka intaqal afra-tafri nahi, balki mukammal taur par muntazam rehmat hai.

Allah ki Hamdardi aur Tarbiyat

  • Yeh kahani Allah ka rawaiya zahir karti hai: ikhlaas wale talaash karne walon ko unki khwahish par saza nahi di jaati, balki nishaniyon ke zariye taleem di jaati hai—shaq, jab imaan se jud jaaye, toh khud yaqeen ka raasta ban sakta hai.
  • Ijtemai pehlu—Uzayr ki wapsi ka kitab aur imaan ko bahaal karna—saabit karta hai ki infiradi maujize ijtemai hidayat aur rehmat ke bade maqsad ki khidmat karte hain.

Tarikhi aur Deeni Ahmiyat

Islami riwayat mein, Uzayr (AS) ko unke sabr, aajizi aur imaan ko bahaal karne wale ke kirdaar ke liye izzat di jaati hai—agarche unhein bade qanoon-saaz paighambaron mein shumar nahi kiya jaata. Unki kahani jismaani qayamat ke aqeede par zor deti hai, shak-parasti (mominon aur munkiron, dono ki taraf se) ko radd karti hai, aur tasdeeq karti hai ki Ilahi qudrat tamam na-mumkinat ko gher leti hai.

Waqt ke saath, is misaal ne Islami deeniyat mein ma’ad (Aakhirat) par behson ko mazboot kiya. Sufi ustaad “sau saal ki neend” ko ghaflat ki behoshi ke liye ek istiaara (allegory) maante hain, jismein bedaari roohani baseerat ki taraf wapsi hai. Gadhe ki maujizati dobara tameer Allah ki rehmat ki bareek tafseel ko zahir karti hai—takhleeq mein kuch bhi, chahe kitna hi bhula ya bosida kyun na ho, Uske hukum se bahaali se pare nahi hai.

أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَى الَّذِينَ خَرَجُوا مِن دِيَارِهِمْ وَهُمْ أُلُوفٌ حَذَرَ الْمَوْتِ ... ثُمَّ أَحْيَاهُمْ

“Kya tumne un logon par ghaur nahi kiya jo apne gharon se hazaron ki tadaad mein nikle, maut ke darr se? Allah ne unse kaha, ‘Mar jao’; phir Usne unhein dobara zinda kiya...”

Nateeja: Neend, Bedaari aur Waada Dobara Zinda Hua

Uzayr (AS) ki kahani hamesha naya hone wala sabaq hai ki na waqt, na aafat, aur na hi sabse gehri qabr Allah ki rehmat aur qudrat-e-kamila ko rok sakti hai. Khandar ke darmiyan chalna, hairan hona ki zindagi kaise wapas aayegi, qayamat ko apni aankhon se dekhne ki ibtida hai. Farishte gawah khade hain, maut sirf nayi shuruaaton par khulti hai, aur rooh, gadhe ki haddiyon ki tarah, fazl se dobara libaas pehnayi jayegi—sirf Allah ke ek lafz par. Dua hai ki har dil Uzayr ke maujize se ek zinda yaqeen haasil kare: mayoosi umeed ki seher se pehle sirf ek neend hai, aur har khandar—chahe rooh ka ho, sheher ka, ya duniya ka—sabse badi bedaari ke liye manch tayyar karta hai.

stories.title: Zakariyya (AS) and the Birth of Yahya (AS)

content.english:
The Grand Tapestry: The Age of Longing and Renewal

From the line of prophets stretching from Ibrahim to Musa, Dawud, and Sulaiman, the Children of Israel witnessed both guidance and spiritual decline. Centuries passed, trials multiplied, and the fragrance of Divine presence faded in daily life. Amidst this weariness, the sanctuary of Jerusalem—Bayt al-Maqdis—stood as both symbol and hope, where a dwindling priestly order struggled to keep faith alive. It was in this age of longing and spiritual drought that Zakariyya (AS) offered his most poignant supplication, and Allah answered with one of history’s most wondrous births: Yahya (AS), precursor, pure soul, and herald of renewal.

The Main Characters: The Prophet, His Family, and the Heavenly Envoys

  • Zakariyya (AS): An elderly prophet and custodian of the Temple. Known for his asceticism, sincerity, and gentle wisdom, he was responsible for tending the spiritual needs of Israel and guardian to Maryam (AS). Childless and advancing in years, his prayer for a successor was a plea for spiritual continuity, not personal legacy.
  • Yahya (AS): Born miraculously to aged parents, his name (“John” in Christian tradition) was divinely bestowed—unique in history. Yahya was renowned for piety, compassion, self-restraint, and fearless proclamation of Divine truth. He was the forerunner to Isa (AS), making him central to the chain of Abrahamic prophecy.
  • Zakariyya’s Wife: Like Sarah and the mothers of prophetic miracle-children, her barrenness and age became the setting for the manifestation of Allah’s mercy.
  • Maryam (AS): Raised under Zakariyya’s care, her story interlinks profoundly with both prophets, as mother of Isa (AS) and recipient of heavenly miracles witnessed by Zakariyya.
  • Angels:
    • Jibril (Gabriel): The arch-messenger brings glad tidings, proclaims Yahya’s conception, and delivers Divine words that shape destinies.
    • Other angels: Present as comforting presences, their voices affirm wisdom and guidance at the threshold between human prayer and Divine answer.
    • Kiraman Katibin: Recording the whispered prayers, silent tears, and the cosmic joy enveloping the miracle of Yahya’s birth.

The Yearning: Zakariyya’s Prayer and the Sanctuary

Zakariyya (AS), witnessing the miracle of Maryam (AS) receiving provisions out of season in her mihrab, felt the embers of hope rekindled within him. Though old, with his wife past childbearing, he petitioned:

هُنَالِكَ دَعَا زَكَرِيَّا رَبَّهُ ۖ قَالَ رَبِّ هَبْ لِي مِن لَّدُنكَ ذُرِّيَّةً طَيِّبَةً ۖ إِنَّكَ سَمِيعُ الدُّعَاءِ

"Then and there Zakariyya prayed to his Lord; he said, ‘My Lord, grant me from Yourself a good offspring. Indeed, You are the Hearer of supplication.’"

This prayer was not born of despair or worldliness, but from a longing to see the torch of prophecy burn anew and to guard the sanctuary of faith.

The Moment of Divine Glad Tidings: Angels in the Sanctuary

While Zakariyya stood alone in prayer, the angels called to him:

فَنَادَتْهُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ وَهُوَ قَائِمٌ يُصَلِّي فِي الْمِحْرَابِ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يُبَشِّرُكَ بِيَحْيَىٰ...

"So the angels called him while he was standing in prayer in the chamber, 'Indeed, Allah gives you good tidings of Yahya...'"

The tidings were not only of a son, but of a rare name and destiny—Yahya would be “a word from Allah, noble, chaste, a prophet among the righteous.” Zakariyya, awed and trembling, asked for a sign. Allah gave him three days of imposed silence, save by gesture—a time for contemplative gratitude and awe.

The Miraculous Birth and Divine Decree

The Qur’an emphasizes the impossibility of the miracle: Zakariyya’s wife, aged and barren, is made fertile by a single word of command. This is both a sign of Allah’s limitless power and a refutation of doubt.

قَالَ كَذَٰلِكَ قَالَ رَبُّكَ هُوَ عَلَيَّ هَيِّنٌ...

"He said, 'So will it be; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me.''..."

From this union, Yahya was born—exceptional in piety from childhood, a miracle inscribed in both his heart and the fabric of his being.

The Childhood and Virtues of Yahya (AS)

The Qur’an sketches Yahya as pure, disciplined, and reverent from infancy. He is given wisdom while still a boy:

يَا يَحْيَىٰ خُذِ الْكِتَابَ بِقُوَّةٍ ۖ وَآتَيْنَاهُ الْحُكْمَ صَبِيًّا

"O Yahya! Take the Scripture with strength. And We gave him judgement [while yet] a child."

His character was gentle, ascetic, merciful, and utterly devoid of arrogance or rebellion. Like all prophets, Yahya was marked by sincerity, but his entire life would foreshadow the purity required to prepare for Isa (AS)’s advent.

Quranic Verses: The Story of Zakariyya and Yahya

ذِكْرُ رَحْمَتِ رَبِّكَ عَبْدَهُ زَكَرِيَّا * إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُ نِدَاءً خَفِيًّا...

"This is the mention of your Lord's mercy to His servant Zakariyya, when he called to his Lord, a call in secret..."

وَزَكَرِيَّا إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُ رَبِّ لَا تَذَرْنِي فَرْدًا وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ الْوَارِثِينَ

"And [mention] Zakariyya, when he called to his Lord, 'My Lord, do not leave me alone [with no heir], while You are the best of inheritors.'"

يَا زَكَرِيَّا إِنَّا نُبَشِّرُكَ بِغُلَامٍ اسْمُهُ يَحْيَىٰ لَمْ نَجْعَل لَّهُ مِن قَبْلُ سَمِيًّا

"O Zakariyya, indeed We give you good tidings of a boy whose name will be Yahya. We have not assigned to any before this name."

وَسَلَامٌ عَلَيْهِ يَوْمَ وُلِدَ وَيَوْمَ يَمُوتُ وَيَوْمَ يُبْعَثُ حَيًّا

"And peace be upon him the day he was born, and the day he dies, and the day he is raised alive."

The Angels and the Unseen Support

  • Jibril (AS): Delivers the news, fortifies Zakariyya against disbelief, and heralds the continuity of prophethood—his words ignite hope across the generations.
  • Other angels: In Qur’anic and Hadith tradition, they offer prayers for Zakariyya, witness Yahya’s growth, and celebrate Divine mercy with peace and rejoicing. Their presence underscores that the miracle is cosmic, not personal.
  • Kiraman Katibin: Recording every whispered prayer, every act of gratitude and worship. In the moments of silence given to Zakariyya, their record becomes the testament of awe and humility before Divine gift.

The Significance of Yahya: Bridge to Isa (AS) and Renewal

Yahya’s birth was more than an answer to Zakariyya’s longing—it reawakened prophecy, prepared Israel for Isa (AS), and modeled a spiritual renaissance. He was the “Word of Allah” in human form: untainted, incorruptible, and a fearless rebuker of tyranny. His martyrdom—throughstanding injustice from corrupt rulers—became a living parable of prophetic integrity to the world.

Moral, Spiritual, and Philosophical Reflections

Prayer Beyond Possibility

  • Zakariyya (AS) teaches that the heart’s realities are not bound by outward probabilities. Hope, when joined to trust and humility, becomes the forge of miracles.
  • Sincere du‘a (supplication) is never wasted—the knowledge of when or how Allah answers is itself a test and a sign of His wisdom.

Angelic Mediation and the Cosmic Order

  • Divine help often arrives subtly: through the voices of angels, in silent moments, or through the prayers of others provided for our success.
  • The recording of even hidden hope dignifies every soul’s inner reality. The universe responds to whispered faith.

Childrearing, Prophethood, and Purity

  • Yahya’s upbringing models early moral formation. True “inheritance” is not wealth, but devotion, courage, and a nurtured spirit of justice.
  • Intergenerational transmission of faith depends as much on Divine gift as on the sanctity and prayerful striving of parents.

Silence, Contemplation, and Gratitude

  • Zakariyya’s imposed silence reflects the role of awe, contemplation, and inner gratitude in responding to answered prayer.

Historical and Theological Significance

The story of Zakariyya (AS) and Yahya (AS) echoes through Islamic, Christian, and Judaic traditions—central to the Gospel as John the Baptist, venerated in Islam as a prophet, rebuker of sin, and bridge to Isa (AS). In Islamic theology, their story reinforces the doctrine of miraculous births as signs of Allah’s absolute will and unfailing fidelity to His servants. Sufi mystics meditate on Zakariyya’s longing as the perfect yearning for Divine presence; philosophers see in Yahya the ethics of ascetic resistance against cultural decay; for families, their narrative holds the archetype of faithful, intergenerational prayer and spiritual ambition.

إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا يُسَارِعُونَ فِي الْخَيْرَاتِ وَيَدْعُونَنَا رَغَبًا وَرَهَبًا

"Indeed, they used to hasten to good deeds and supplicate Us in hope and fear..."

Conclusion: The Light of Prayer, the Birth of Hope

The story of Zakariyya and Yahya (AS) is the perennial reminder that when darkness thickens and generations stumble, Divine mercy is nearer than breath, and miracles spring from prayerful yearning. Every answered supplication is a song sung over centuries; every righteous child is the invested hope of the world’s future. Zakariyya’s prayer—whispered in dusk, alone in his sanctuary—still reverberates, calling us to trust, dream, and hope against odds. And whenever faithfulness is reborn, it is Yahya’s gentle cry that echoes: Peace be upon him, the day he was born, the day he dies, and the day he is raised alive.
content.hinglish:
Azeem Taana-Baana: Tarap aur Tajdeed (Renewal) ka Daur

Ibrahim se Musa, Dawud aur Sulaiman tak phaili hui paighambaron ki nasl se, Bani Israel ne hidayat aur roohani zawaal, dono dekhe. Sadiyan beet gayin, aazmaishein badh gayin, aur roz-marra ki zindagi mein Ilahi maujoodgi ki khushboo pheeki pad gayi. Is thakawat ke darmiyan, Jerusalem ki muqaddas panahgaah—Bayt al-Maqdis—ek alamat aur umeed, dono ke taur par khadi thi, jahan pujariyon ka ek ghat'ta hua tabqa imaan ko zinda rakhne ke liye jid-o-jehad kar raha tha. Yeh tarap aur roohani qehat ka daur tha jab Zakariyya (AS) ne apni sabse pur-dard dua ki, aur Allah ne tareekh ki sabse hairat-angez paidaishon mein se ek ke saath jawab diya: Yahya (AS), pesh-rau (forerunner), paak rooh, aur tajdeed ka paighambar.

Ahem Kirdaar: Paighambar, Unka Khandan aur Aasmani Paighambar

  • Zakariyya (AS): Ek zaeef paighambar aur Mandir ke nigran. Apne zuhd (asceticism), ikhlaas aur narm-dili wali hikmat ke liye jaane jaate the, woh Israel ki roohani zarooraton ko poora karne ke zimmedar the aur Maryam (AS) ke sarparast the. Be-aulaad aur badhti umr mein, unki ek janasheen ke liye dua zaati meeras ke liye nahi, balki roohani tasalsul ke liye ek iltija thi.
  • Yahya (AS): Zaeef walidain ke yahan maujizati taur par paida hue, unka naam (“John” Isaai riwayat mein) Ilahi taur par ata kiya gaya tha—tareekh mein munfarid. Yahya taqwa, hamdardi, khud-par-qaabu aur Ilahi haqeeqat ke be-khauf ailaan ke liye mash'hoor the. Woh Isa (AS) ke pesh-rau the, jisne unhein Abrahami silsila-e-nabuwwat mein markazi bana diya.
  • Zakariyya ki Biwi: Sarah aur paighambarana maujizati bachon ki maaon ki tarah, unki baanjh-pan aur umr Allah ki rehmat ke zahoor ka manzar ban gayi.
  • Maryam (AS): Zakariyya ki nigrani mein parwarish paayin, unki kahani dono paighambaron se gehri munsalik hai, Isa (AS) ki walida ke taur par aur aasmani maujizon ki haamil ke taur par jinke gawah Zakariyya the.
  • Farishte:
    • Jibril (Gabriel): Sabse bade paighambar khush-khabri laate hain, Yahya ke hamal ka ailaan karte hain, aur qismaton ko shakal dene wale Ilahi alfaaz pahunchate hain.
    • Deegar farishte: Tassalli dene wali maujoodgiyon ke taur par, unki awaazein insani dua aur Ilahi jawab ke darmiyan dehleez par hikmat aur hidayat ki tasdeeq karti hain.
    • Kiraman Katibin: Sargoshi mein ki gayi duaon, khamosh aansuon aur Yahya ki paidaish ko gherne wali kainaati khushi ko record karte hue.

Tarap: Zakariyya ki Dua aur Ibadat-gaah

Zakariyya (AS), Maryam (AS) ko apne mihrab mein be-mausam rizq haasil karte hue dekh kar, apne andar umeed ki chingari ko dobara jalte hue mehsoos karte hain. Agarche boodhe the, aur unki biwi bachhe paida karne ki umr se guzar chuki theen, unhone iltija ki:

هُنَالِكَ دَعَا زَكَرِيَّا رَبَّهُ ۖ قَالَ رَبِّ هَبْ لِي مِن لَّدُنكَ ذُرِّيَّةً طَيِّبَةً ۖ إِنَّكَ سَمِيعُ الدُّعَاءِ

“Wahin par Zakariyya ne apne Rab se dua ki; unhone kaha, ‘Aye mere Rab, mujhe Apni taraf se ek acchi aulaad ata farma. Beshak, Tu dua ko Sunne wala hai.’”

Yeh dua mayoosi ya dunyadari se paida nahi hui thi, balki nabuwwat ki mash'al ko naye sire se jalte hue dekhne aur imaan ki panahgaah ki hifazat karne ki tarap se thi.

Ilahi Khush-khabri ka Lamha: Ibadat-gaah mein Farishte

Jab Zakariyya ibadat mein akele khade the, toh farishton ne unhein pukara:

فَنَادَتْهُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ وَهُوَ قَائِمٌ يُصَلِّي فِي الْمِحْرَابِ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يُبَشِّرُكَ بِيَحْيَىٰ...

“Toh farishton ne unhein pukara jab woh kamre mein namaz padh rahe the, ‘Beshak, Allah tumhein Yahya ki khush-khabri deta hai...’”

Khush-khabri na sirf ek bete ki thi, balki ek nayaab naam aur qismat ki bhi—Yahya “Allah ki taraf se ek kalma, shareef, paak-daaman, neikon mein se ek paighambar” honge. Zakariyya, hairat aur khauf se kaanpte hue, ek nishani maangi. Allah ne unhein teen din ki zabardasti khamoshi di, siwaye isharon ke—jo shukr-guzari aur haibat ke liye ghaur-o-fikr ka waqt tha.

Maujizati Paidaish aur Ilahi Faisla

Qur’an maujize ki na-mumkini par zor deta hai: Zakariyya ki biwi, zaeef aur baanjh, ek hukum ke lafz se haamila ho jaati hain. Yeh Allah ki be-inteha qudrat ki nishani bhi hai aur shaq ka inkaar bhi.

قَالَ كَذَٰلِكَ قَالَ رَبُّكَ هُوَ عَلَيَّ هَيِّنٌ...

“Unhone kaha, ‘Aisa hi hoga; tumhare Rab ne farmaya, ‘Yeh Mere liye aasan hai.’...’”

Is milap se, Yahya paida hue—bachpan se hi taqwa mein la-sani, ek maujiza jo unke dil aur unke wujood, dono mein likha hua tha.

Yahya (AS) ka Bachpan aur Fazail

Qur’an Yahya ko bachpan se hi paak, ba-zabt aur mohtaram ke taur par bayan karta hai. Unhein bachpan mein hi hikmat di gayi:

يَا يَحْيَىٰ خُذِ الْكِتَابَ بِقُوَّةٍ ۖ وَآتَيْنَاهُ الْحُكْمَ صَبِيًّا

“Aye Yahya! Kitab ko mazbooti se pakdo. Aur Humne unhein bachpan mein hi faisle [ki salahiyat] di.”

Unka kirdaar narm-dil, zahidana, reham-dil aur takabbur ya baghawat se bilkul paak tha. Tamam paighambaron ki tarah, Yahya ikhlaas se pehchane jaate the, lekin unki poori zindagi us paakizgi ki pesh-goi karegi jo Isa (AS) ki aamad ki tayyari ke liye zaroori thi.

Qurani Aayat: Zakariyya aur Yahya ki Kahani

ذِكْرُ رَحْمَتِ رَبِّكَ عَبْدَهُ زَكَرِيَّا * إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُ نِدَاءً خَفِيًّا...

“Yeh tumhare Rab ki apne bande Zakariyya par rehmat ka zikr hai, jab unhone apne Rab ko posheeda pukar mein pukara...”

وَزَكَرِيَّا إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُ رَبِّ لَا تَذَرْنِي فَرْدًا وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ الْوَارِثِينَ

“Aur [Zakariyya ko yaad karo], jab unhone apne Rab ko pukara, ‘Aye mere Rab, mujhe akela na chhod [bina waris ke], jabki Tu sabse behtareen waris hai.’”

يَا زَكَرِيَّا إِنَّا نُبَشِّرُكَ بِغُلَامٍ اسْمُهُ يَحْيَىٰ لَمْ نَجْعَل لَّهُ مِن قَبْلُ سَمِيًّا

“Aye Zakariyya, beshak Hum tumhein ek ladke ki khush-khabri dete hain jiska naam Yahya hoga. Humne isse pehle yeh naam kisi ko nahi diya.”

وَسَلَامٌ عَلَيْهِ يَوْمَ وُلِدَ وَيَوْمَ يَمُوتُ وَيَوْمَ يُبْعَثُ حَيًّا

“Aur us par salaam ho jis din woh paida hua, aur jis din woh faut hoga, aur jis din woh zinda uthaya jayega.”

Farishte aur Ghaibi Madad

  • Jibril (AS): Khabar pahunchate hain, Zakariyya ko be-yaqeeni ke khilaaf mazboot karte hain, aur nabuwwat ke tasalsul ka ailaan karte hain—unke alfaaz naslon mein umeed jagate hain.
  • Deegar farishte: Qurani aur Hadith ki riwayat mein, woh Zakariyya ke liye duaein karte hain, Yahya ki nash-o-numa ke gawah bante hain, aur Ilahi rehmat ka jashn aman aur khushi ke saath manate hain. Unki maujoodgi is baat par zor deti hai ki maujiza kainaati hai, zaati nahi.
  • Kiraman Katibin: Har sargoshi mein ki gayi dua, shukr-guzari aur ibadat ke har amal ko record karte hue. Zakariyya ko di gayi khamoshi ke lamhaat mein, unka record Ilahi tohfe ke saamne haibat aur aajizi ki gawaahi ban jaata hai.

Yahya ki Ahmiyat: Isa (AS) tak Pul aur Tajdeed

Yahya ki paidaish Zakariyya ki tarap ka jawab hone se kahin badh kar thi—isne nabuwwat ko dobara zinda kiya, Israel ko Isa (AS) ke liye tayyar kiya, aur ek roohani be-dari ka namoona pesh kiya. Woh insani shakal mein “Allah ka Kalma” the: be-daagh, na-qabil-e-kharabi, aur zulm ke be-khauf mukhalif. Unki shahadat—kharab hukmaranon ke zulm ke saamne dat kar—duniya ke liye paighambarana ikhlaqi-jurrat ki ek zinda misaal ban gayi.

Akhlaqi, Roohani aur Falsafiyana Ghaur-o-Fikr

Imkaan se Pare Dua

  • Zakariyya (AS) sikhate hain ki dil ki haqeeqatein zahiri imkanaat ki paband nahi hain. Umeed, jab bharose aur aajizi se jud jaaye, toh maujizon ki bhatti ban jaati hai.
  • Ikhlaas bhari du‘a (dua) kabhi zaya nahi jaati—Allah kab ya kaise jawab dete hain iska ilm khud ek imtehan aur Uski hikmat ki nishani hai.

Farishton ki Wasatat aur Kainaati Nizaam

  • Ilahi madad aksar bareeki se aati hai: farishton ki awaazon ke zariye, khamosh lamhaat mein, ya hamari kamyabi ke liye faraham ki gayi doosron ki duaon ke zariye.
  • Posheeda umeed ka bhi record hona har rooh ki andarooni haqeeqat ko izzat deta hai. Kainat sargoshi wale imaan ka jawab deti hai.

Aulaad ki Parwarish, Nabuwwat aur Paakizgi

  • Yahya ki parwarish ibtidai akhlaqi tarbiyat ka namoona hai. Asli “meeras” daulat nahi, balki ibadat, himmat aur parwarish paayi hui insaaf ki rooh hai.
  • Naslon mein imaan ki muntaqili jitni Ilahi tohfe par munhasir hai utni hi walidain ki paakizgi aur dua bhari koshish par bhi hai.

Khamoshi, Ghaur-o-Fikr aur Shukr-guzari

  • Zakariyya ki zabardasti khamoshi qubool hui dua ke jawab mein haibat, ghaur-o-fikr aur andarooni shukr-guzari ke kirdaar ko zahir karti hai.

Tarikhi aur Deeni Ahmiyat

Zakariyya (AS) aur Yahya (AS) ki kahani Islami, Isaai aur Yahudi riwayaton mein goonjti hai—Gospel mein John the Baptist ke taur par markazi, Islam mein ek paighambar, gunah ke mukhalif aur Isa (AS) tak pul ke taur par mohtaram. Islami deeniyat mein, unki kahani maujizati paidaishon ke aqeede ko Allah ki mutlaq marzi aur Apne bandon ke liye Uski na-khatam hone wali wafadari ki nishaniyon ke taur par mazboot karti hai. Soofi mystics Zakariyya ki tarap ko Ilahi maujoodgi ke liye mukammal khwahish ke taur par ghaur karte hain; falsafi Yahya mein saqafati zawaal ke khilaaf zahidana muzahimat (ascetic resistance) ki akhlaqiyat dekhte hain; khandan ke liye, unki kahani wafadar, naslon dar naslon dua aur roohani tamanna ki misaal rakhti hai.

إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا يُسَارِعُونَ فِي الْخَيْرَاتِ وَيَدْعُونَنَا رَغَبًا وَرَهَبًا

“Beshak, woh nekiyon mein jaldi karte the aur humein umeed aur khauf mein pukarte the...”

Nateeja: Dua ki Roshni, Umeed ki Paidaish

Zakariyya aur Yahya (AS) ki kahani hamesha ki yaad-dehani hai ki jab tareeki ghani hoti hai aur naslein dagmagati hain, toh Ilahi rehmat saans se zyada qareeb hoti hai, aur maujize dua bhari tarap se paida hote hain. Har qubool hui dua sadiyon se gaya gaya ek geet hai; har neik bachha duniya ke mustaqbil ki lagayi gayi umeed hai. Zakariyya ki dua—shaam ki dhundalki mein sargoshi ki gayi, apni ibadat-gaah mein akele—ab bhi goonjti hai, hamein bharosa karne, khwab dekhne aur mushkilat ke khilaaf umeed rakhne ki dawat deti hai. Aur jab bhi wafadari dobara janam leti hai, toh yeh Yahya ki narm pukar hai jo goonjti hai: Us par salaam ho, jis din woh paida hua, jis din woh faut hoga, aur jis din woh zinda uthaya jayega.

content.english:
The Grand Tapestry: A New Dawn in the Sacred House

Across generations, after the prayers of Zakariyya (AS) and the miraculous birth of Yahya (AS), a profound silence shrouded the Children of Israel. In the holy sanctuary of Jerusalem, amidst a community yearning for spiritual revival, a new moment forged itself into the cosmic design—heralding not only a miracle, but the arrival of one who would be a sign for all worlds. At the heart of this event stands Maryam (AS)—Mary, the epitome of chastity, devotion, and surrender. Her life, the womb of prophecy, and the birth of ‘Isa (AS)—Jesus—would become a living testament to Allah’s power and mercy, echoing through Qur’anic revelation and the history of all Abrahamic faiths.

The Principal Figures: Maryam, the Divine Child, and the Angelic Envoys

  • Maryam (AS): Raised in purity under the patronage of Zakariyya (AS), Maryam distinguished herself through ceaseless worship and incomparable chastity. Her devotion, humility, and steadfastness marked her as one favored above all women.
  • ‘Isa (AS): Born by Divine command without a father, ‘Isa (Jesus) is the Kalimah (Word) and Ruh (Spirit) from Allah, a sign to humanity, and prophet of unwavering resolve.
  • Jibril (Gabriel, AS): The archangel appears to Maryam in human form, delivering glad tidings, comfort, and the very word of Divine creation.
  • Angels: The Qur’an mentions the presence of many angels, bringing news, offering reassurance, and glorifying Maryam. The Kiraman Katibin record prayers, tears, and miracles—the celestial witness to the unfolding event.
  • The People of Jerusalem: Their suspicion and gossip became the backdrop for the miracle to shine, and their reactions would become part of the story’s spiritual lesson.

Maryam’s Piety and the Angelic Annunciation

From childhood, Maryam was nurtured in the mihrab, receiving sustenance beyond earthly season and growing in spiritual favor. When Allah’s decree approached, the angels addressed her:

وَإِذْ قَالَتِ الْمَلَائِكَةُ يَا مَرْيَمُ إِنَّ اللَّهَ اصْطَفَاكِ وَطَهَّرَكِ وَاصْطَفَاكِ عَلَىٰ نِسَاءِ الْعَالَمِينَ

"And when the angels said, 'O Mary, indeed Allah has chosen you and purified you and chosen you above the women of the worlds.'"

Her seclusion in worship became the scene for Jibril’s (AS) descent. Appearing as a well-formed man, he shook her with awe and fear:

قَالَ إِنَّمَا أَنَا رَسُولُ رَبِّكِ لِأَهَبَ لَكِ غُلَامًا زَكِيًّا

"He said, 'I am only the messenger of your Lord to give you [news of] a pure boy.'"

Maryam’s response, a model of faith and humility, was “How can I have a son, when no man has touched me?” Jibril reassures her: "So (it will be). Your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me.'"

The Miraculous Conception and Divine Decree

By the word كن (“Be!”), the spirit was created in her womb with no father, a miracle echoing the creation of Adam (AS) and a sign to the world that Allah’s will is unbounded by material causality. Every atom of the universe—angels, time, and nature itself—moves in obedience to His command:

قَالَ كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِ هُوَ عَلَيَّ هَيِّنٌ وَلِنَجْعَلَهُ آيَةً لِلنَّاسِ وَرَحْمَةً مِّنَّا

"He said, 'So it will be; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, and We will make him a sign to the people and a mercy from Us...'"

Maryam’s Solitude, Labor, and Angelic Support

In seclusion, carrying her Divine trust, Maryam withdrew to a distant place. Here, pain, fear, and loneliness pushed her to the very edge of endurance. In the throes of childbirth by the trunk of a palm tree, she uttered her wish for annihilation—an echo of the soul’s struggles in the darkest night. At this point, Divine mercy manifests through angelic comfort:

فَنَادَاهَا مِن تَحْتِهَا أَلَّا تَحْزَنِي ... وَهُزِّي إِلَيْكِ بِجِذْعِ النَّخْلَةِ تُسَاقِطْ عَلَيْكِ رُطَبًا جَنِيًّا

"But he called her from beneath her, 'Do not grieve; your Lord has provided beneath you a stream. And shake toward you the trunk of the palm tree; it will drop upon you ripe, fresh dates.'"

Thus, the angels bring not only miraculous news, but practical comfort: water, food, and reassurance in the loneliest hour.

The Birth of ‘Isa (AS): The Sign and the Struggle

With the birth accomplished and her infant in arms, Maryam’s return to her people becomes the miracle’s crucible. The people’s mockery and accusations thunder, yet Maryam—commanded by Allah—remains silent, relying upon the child himself to speak:

فَأَشَارَتْ إِلَيْهِ ... قَالَ إِنِّي عَبْدُ اللَّهِ آتَانِيَ الْكِتَابَ وَجَعَلَنِي نَبِيًّا

"She pointed to him. They said, 'How can we speak to one who is in the cradle, a child?' [Isa] said, 'Indeed, I am the servant of Allah. He has given me the Scripture and made me a prophet...'"

Key Quranic Verses: Maryam, the Angels, and ‘Isa’s (AS) Birth

وَاذْكُرْ فِي الْكِتَابِ مَرْيَمَ ... إِذِ انتَبَذَتْ مِنْ أَهْلِهَا مَكَانًا شَرْقِيًّا

"And mention, [O Muhammad], in the Book [the story of] Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place toward the east."

وَمَرْيَمَ ابْنَتَ عِمْرَانَ ... وَصَدَّقَتْ بِكَلِمَاتِ رَبِّهَا ... وَكَانَتْ مِنَ الْقَانِتِينَ

"And [the example of] Mary, the daughter of ‘Imran, who guarded her chastity, so We blew into [her garment] through Our angel, and she believed in the Words of her Lord and His scriptures and was of the devoutly obedient."

إِذْ قَالَتِ الْمَلَائِكَةُ يَا مَرْيَمُ ... إِنَّ اللّهَ يُبَشِّرُكِ بِكَلِمَةٍ مِّنْهُ ... اسْمُهُ الْمَسِيحُ عِيسَى ابْنُ مَرْيَمَ ...

"When the angels said, 'O Mary! Indeed Allah gives you good tidings of a word from Him, whose name will be the Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary...'"

Philosophical and Spiritual Reflections: Lessons from the Birth of ‘Isa (AS)

The Power and Compassion of Divine Will

  • The entire narrative is a living refutation of material determinism. Where the world sees impossibility, Allah opens new horizons by His word—He creates "what He wills".
  • The birth of ‘Isa (AS) is both miracle and comfort: a sign that Allah’s mercy arrives when all other supports fall away, and that patience, prayer, and surrender are honored with relief.

The Role of Angels: Agents of glad tidings and Healing

  • Angels, especially Jibril (AS), are not bystanders. They bring Divine decree, remind of Allah’s nearness, provide material support, and protect the chosen from despair.
  • Their words and presence reinforce the promise that every true believer—especially the patient in trial—is surrounded by invisible allies.

The Virtue of Chastity, Trust, and Surrender

  • Maryam (AS) embodies a fusion of dignity, humility, and faith. Her example sanctifies feminine piety and the endurance to hold onto dignity amid slander and solitude.
  • Her trust, silent endurance, and willingness to act when commanded—shaking the palm tree, presenting the baby as answer—are blueprints for how to receive and respond to Divine grace.

The Voice of the Innocent: ‘Isa’s (AS) First Miracle

  • The newborn ‘Isa’s (AS) speech is a declaration of servitude, prophethood, and scriptural continuity, refuting the doubts and sins of others through innocence and truth.
  • It confirms that Divine aid comes from where no one expects, and vindication follows steadfastness in the cause of Allah.

Historical and Theological Significance in Islamic Thought

The stories of Maryam (AS) and the birth of ‘Isa (AS) are unparalleled in the Qur’an and cherished in Islamic spirituality. They affirm:

  • Oneness and Omnipotence of Allah: That creation is His act alone, and He is not begotten, nor does He beget.
  • Prophethood and Purity: ‘Isa (AS) is honored as prophet, not divine. Maryam (AS) is esteemed as the mother of a prophet, not an object of divinity.
  • Sign for All Times: The miraculous birth was not a mere historical event, but an archetype of hope for the hopeless, proof against doubters, and a call to patient certainty in every epoch.
  • Model for Piety: Both Maryam (AS) and ‘Isa (AS) are exemplars of trust, humility, devotion to God, and compassion for humanity.

وَجَعَلْنَا ابْنَ مَرْيَمَ وَأُمَّهُ آيَةً

"And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign..."

Conclusion: The Living Parable of Hope

The story of Maryam (AS) and the birth of ‘Isa (AS) is an undying fountain of inspiration: teaching that the most luminous faith can flower in darkness, and the greatest miracles unfold in moments of solitude, slander, and seeming impossibility. When calamity or doubt closes in, let every seeker remember—the Lord who opened the womb of Maryam, who sent angels to comfort and provide, is still the Giver of Life, the Keeper of Promises, and the Answerer of Prayers. May all hearts find assurance in her night, and all hopes echo the first cry of ‘Isa (AS): “Indeed, I am the servant of Allah…”
content.hinglish:
Azeem Taana-Baana: Muqaddas Ghar mein ek Nayi Seher

Naslon ke paar, Zakariyya (AS) ki duaon aur Yahya (AS) ki maujizati paidaish ke baad, Bani Israel par ek gehra sannata chha gaya. Jerusalem ki muqaddas ibadat-gaah mein, roohani be-daari ke liye tarasti ek qaum ke darmiyan, ek naya lamha kainaati mansoobe mein shamil ho gaya—na sirf ek maujize ka ailaan karte hue, balki ek aisi hasti ki aamad ka jo tamam jahano ke liye ek nishani banegi. Is waqiye ke markaz mein Maryam (AS)—Mary—khadi hain, jo paak-daamani, ibadat aur ita'at ki misaal hain. Unki zindagi, nabuwwat ka rahem (womb), aur ‘Isa (AS)—Jesus—ki paidaish, Allah ki qudrat aur rehmat ki ek zinda gawaahi banegi, jo Qurani wahi aur tamam Abrahami mazahib ki tareekh mein goonjti hai.

Asal Kirdaar: Maryam, Ilahi Bachha aur Aasmani Paighambar

  • Maryam (AS): Zakariyya (AS) ki sarparasti mein paakizgi mein parwarish paayin, Maryam ne musalsal ibadat aur be-misaal paak-daamani se khud ko mumtaz kiya. Unki lagan, aajizi aur saabit-qadmi ne unhein tamam auraton par fazilat wali nishani bana diya.
  • ‘Isa (AS): Bina baap ke Ilahi hukum se paida hue, ‘Isa (Jesus) Allah ki taraf se Kalimah (Kalam) aur Ruh (Rooh) hain, insaniyat ke liye ek nishani, aur atal azm wale paighambar.
  • Jibril (Gabriel, AS): Sabse bade farishte Maryam ke saamne insani shakal mein zahir hote hain, khush-khabri, tassalli aur Ilahi takhleeq ka lafz laate hue.
  • Farishte: Qur’an bahut se farishton ki maujoodgi ka zikr karta hai, jo khabar laate, yaqeen dilate aur Maryam ki badai bayan karte hain. Kiraman Katibin duaon, aansuon aur maujizon ko record karte hain—is waqiye ke aasmani gawah.
  • Jerusalem ke Log: Unka shaq aur tohmat-tarashi maujize ke chamakne ka pas-manzar ban gaye, aur unke radd-e-amal kahani ke roohani sabaq ka hissa ban gaye.

Maryam ki Parhezgari aur Farishton ka Ailaan

Bachpan se, Maryam ko mihrab mein parwarish mili, unhein dunyavi mausam se pare rizq milta aur woh roohani fazl mein badhti gayin. Jab Allah ka faisla qareeb aaya, toh farishton ne unse mukhatib ho kar kaha:

وَإِذْ قَالَتِ الْمَلَائِكَةُ يَا مَرْيَمُ إِنَّ اللَّهَ اصْطَفَاكِ وَطَهَّرَكِ وَاصْطَفَاكِ عَلَىٰ نِسَاءِ الْعَالَمِينَ

“Aur jab farishton ne kaha, ‘Aye Maryam, beshak Allah ne tumhein chun liya hai aur tumhein paak kiya hai aur tumhein tamam jahano ki auraton par chun liya hai.’”

Ibadat mein unki tanhai Jibril (AS) ke nazool ka manzar ban gayi. Ek khoobsurat insaan ki shakal mein zahir ho kar, unhone Maryam ko haibat aur khauf se hila diya:

قَالَ إِنَّمَا أَنَا رَسُولُ رَبِّكِ لِأَهَبَ لَكِ غُلَامًا زَكِيًّا

“Usne kaha, ‘Main sirf tumhare Rab ka paighambar hoon taaki tumhein ek paak ladke ki [khabar] doon.’”

Maryam ka jawab, imaan aur aajizi ka ek namoona, yeh tha: “Mere yahan beta kaise ho sakta hai, jabki mujhe kisi mard ne nahi chhua?” Jibril unhein yaqeen dilate hain: “Aisa hi hoga. Tumhara Rab farmata hai, ‘Yeh Mere liye aasan hai.’”

Maujizati Hamal aur Ilahi Faisla

Lafz كن (“Ho ja!”) se, unke rahem mein bina baap ke rooh paida ki gayi, ek maujiza jo Adam (AS) ki takhleeq ki goonj tha aur duniya ke liye ek nishani ki Allah ki marzi maadi asbaab (material causality) ki paband nahi hai. Kainat ka har zarra—farishte, waqt aur qudrat khud—Uske hukum ki ita'at mein harkat karta hai:

قَالَ كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِ هُوَ عَلَيَّ هَيِّنٌ وَلِنَجْعَلَهُ آيَةً لِلنَّاسِ وَرَحْمَةً مِّنَّا

“Usne kaha, ‘Aisa hi hoga; tumhara Rab farmata hai, ‘Yeh Mere liye aasan hai, aur Hum use logon ke liye ek nishani aur Apni taraf se ek rehmat banayenge...’”

Maryam ki Tanhai, Dard-e-zeh aur Farishton ki Madad
